Stem: Cream to yellow or brown with fine hairs, only flowering stem above ground.
Flowers: Pale blue to violet, trumpet shaped, 1-2 cm long.
FruitSeeds: Dull yellowish brown, single capsule containing hundreds of tiny seeds.
Habitat: No habitat preference, based on host plants.
DistinguishingFeatures: Very distinct, lack of chlorophll. Introduced species can be distinguished from native by host plant, native Broomrapes prey on native plants only.

Photos.Caption: Does not have its own leaves
